trans-unit.source: Configuring Workflow Accelerator

seg-source.mrk: Configuring Workflow Accelerator

trans-unit.source: Install the license file

seg-source.mrk: Install the license file

trans-unit.source: You have received the Workflow Accelerator license file, <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">license.xml</kbd>, along with the Workflow Accelerator application. Before you can start the Workflow Accelerator system, you have to add the license file to the application. Copy the license file into the directory <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">$TOMCAT_HOME/webapps/ROOT/WEB-INF/classes</kbd>. The Workflow Accelerator system will check your license file on startup and set up the defined number of licenses.

seg-source.mrk: You have received the Workflow Accelerator license file, <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">license.xml</kbd>, along with the Workflow Accelerator application.
Before you can start the Workflow Accelerator system, you have to add the license file to the application.
Copy the license file into the directory <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">$TOMCAT_HOME/webapps/ROOT/WEB-INF/classes</kbd>.
The Workflow Accelerator system will check your license file on startup and set up the defined number of licenses.

trans-unit.source: Update the Workflow Accelerator configuration file

seg-source.mrk: Update the Workflow Accelerator configuration file

trans-unit.source: Before you can start Workflow Accelerator for the first time, you need to configure some mandatory properties in the Workflow Accelerator configuration file. Make sure you have copied the Workflow Accelerator web application to the Tomcat’s webapps directory before continuing. The configuration file can be found here <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">$TOMCAT_HOME/webapps/ROOT/WEB-INF/classes/effektif-onpremise.properties</kbd>.

seg-source.mrk: Before you can start Workflow Accelerator for the first time, you need to configure some mandatory properties in the Workflow Accelerator configuration file.
Make sure you have copied the Workflow Accelerator web application to the Tomcat’s webapps directory before continuing.
The configuration file can be found here <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">$TOMCAT_HOME/webapps/ROOT/WEB-INF/classes/effektif-onpremise.properties</kbd>.

trans-unit.source: In general, the configuration allows to configure the base URL of the Workflow Accelerator system, the mail server, the database connection and integrations with third party systems (e.g. Signavio). If you installed the Workflow Accelerator Script Engine, you need to configure the URL to the script engine as well. As described in <MadCap:xref href="install-script-engine.htm#InstallingWAScriptE" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">Installing the Workflow Accelerator Script Engine </MadCap:xref> the URL derives from the domain (<kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">localhost</kbd> for the same machine) and port the script engine is running on. If you installed the Workflow Accelerator Mail Relay, you need to enable the email trigger and set the email domain that you created during the set-up.

seg-source.mrk: In general, the configuration allows to configure the base URL of the Workflow Accelerator system, the mail server, the database connection and integrations with third party systems (e.g. Signavio).
If you installed the Workflow Accelerator Script Engine, you need to configure the URL to the script engine as well.

As described in <MadCap:xref href="install-script-engine.htm#InstallingWAScriptE" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">Installing the Workflow Accelerator Script Engine </MadCap:xref> the URL derives from the domain (<kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">localhost</kbd> for the same machine) and port the script engine is running on.
If you installed the Workflow Accelerator Mail Relay, you need to enable the email trigger and set the email domain that you created during the set-up.

trans-unit.source: effektif.baseUrl

seg-source.mrk: effektif.baseUrl

trans-unit.source: (Required) The IP address or server name (including the port) of the server running the Workflow Accelerator Tomcat application server. E.g. <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">http://workflow.yourdomain.com:8080</kbd> If the server is running on port 80, the port can be omitted.

seg-source.mrk: (Required) The IP address or server name (including the port) of the server running the Workflow Accelerator Tomcat application server.
E.g.
<kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">http://workflow.yourdomain.com:8080</kbd> If the server is running on port 80, the port can be omitted.

trans-unit.source: effektif.smtp.host

seg-source.mrk: effektif.smtp.host

trans-unit.source: (Required) The IP address or server name of the outgoing email server.

seg-source.mrk: (Required) The IP address or server name of the outgoing email server.

trans-unit.source: effektif.smtp.port

seg-source.mrk: effektif.smtp.port

trans-unit.source: The port on which the outgoing SMTP server listens

seg-source.mrk: The port on which the outgoing SMTP server listens

trans-unit.source: effektif.smtp.ssl

seg-source.mrk: effektif.smtp.ssl

trans-unit.source: If SSL should be used ( true or false )

seg-source.mrk: If SSL should be used ( true or false )

trans-unit.source: If TLS should be used ( true or false )

seg-source.mrk: If TLS should be used ( true or false )

seg-source.mrk: effektif.smtp.user

trans-unit.source: The username for authentication

seg-source.mrk: The username for authentication

trans-unit.source: The password for authentication

seg-source.mrk: The password for authentication

trans-unit.source: effektif.mail.from

seg-source.mrk: effektif.mail.from

trans-unit.source: This email address is used as the sender when the Workflow Accelerator system sends out notifications.

seg-source.mrk: This email address is used as the sender when the Workflow Accelerator system sends out notifications.

trans-unit.source: effektif.mail.feedback

seg-source.mrk: effektif.mail.feedback

trans-unit.source: This email address will receive all feedback which is sent using the feedback functionality in the application.

seg-source.mrk: This email address will receive all feedback which is sent using the feedback functionality in the application.

trans-unit.source: effektif.mongodb.servers

seg-source.mrk: effektif.mongodb.servers

trans-unit.source: A comma-separated list of MongoDB servers (hostnames). If you have MongodDB running on the same server as Tomcat, the default value of localhost is okay.

seg-source.mrk: A comma-separated list of MongoDB servers (hostnames).
If you have MongodDB running on the same server as Tomcat, the default value of localhost is okay.

trans-unit.source: effektif.mongodb.username

seg-source.mrk: effektif.mongodb.username

trans-unit.source: The Workflow Accelerator MongoDB user name. If you created the user following the instructions in this guide, the name is <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">signavio</kbd>.

seg-source.mrk: The Workflow Accelerator MongoDB user name.
If you created the user following the instructions in this guide, the name is <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">signavio</kbd>.

trans-unit.source: effektif.mongodb.password

seg-source.mrk: effektif.mongodb.password

trans-unit.source: The password of the Workflow Accelerator MongoDB user. This is the password you defined during user creation.

seg-source.mrk: The password of the Workflow Accelerator MongoDB user.
This is the password you defined during user creation.

trans-unit.source: effektif.mongodb.database

seg-source.mrk: effektif.mongodb.database

trans-unit.source: The name of the database Workflow Accelerator should use. The default value <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">signavio</kbd> is okay.

seg-source.mrk: The name of the database Workflow Accelerator should use.
The default value <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">signavio</kbd> is okay.

trans-unit.source: effektif.javascript.server.url

seg-source.mrk: effektif.javascript.server.url

trans-unit.source: (Optional) The URL of the Workflow Accelerator Script Engine, e.g. <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">http://localhost:8081</kbd>

seg-source.mrk: (Optional) The URL of the Workflow Accelerator Script Engine, e.g. <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">http://localhost:8081</kbd>

trans-unit.source: effektif.mail.receiver.enabled

seg-source.mrk: effektif.mail.receiver.enabled

trans-unit.source: (Optional) Activates the email trigger if set to <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">true</kbd>. You have to set up the mail relay for the trigger to work properly.

seg-source.mrk: (Optional) Activates the email trigger if set to <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">true</kbd>.
You have to set up the mail relay for the trigger to work properly.

trans-unit.source: effektif.mail.receiver.domain

seg-source.mrk: effektif.mail.receiver.domain

trans-unit.source: (Optional) The email domain which is used to receive emails for the email trigger. The same value must be configured for the mail relay.

seg-source.mrk: (Optional) The email domain which is used to receive emails for the email trigger.
The same value must be configured for the mail relay.

trans-unit.source: effektif.google.secrets.location

seg-source.mrk: effektif.google.secrets.location

trans-unit.source: (Optional) Absolute path to the Google APIs OAuth 2.0 credentials file, see <MadCap:xref href="../optional-configuration/google-service-actions.htm#ConfigureGoogleService" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">Configure Google service actions </MadCap:xref>.

seg-source.mrk: (Optional) Absolute path to the Google APIs OAuth 2.0 credentials file, see <MadCap:xref href="../optional-configuration/google-service-actions.htm#ConfigureGoogleService" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">Configure Google service actions </MadCap:xref>.

trans-unit.source: The following properties are only relevant if your Workflow Accelerator installation is connected to your Signavio installation.

seg-source.mrk: The following properties are only relevant if your Workflow Accelerator installation is connected to your Signavio installation.

trans-unit.source: See <MadCap:xref href="../process-manager-integration/process-manager-integration.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd"> Signavio Process Manager integration </MadCap:xref> for more information on how to set up the integration.

seg-source.mrk: See <MadCap:xref href="../process-manager-integration/process-manager-integration.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd"> Signavio Process Manager integration </MadCap:xref> for more information on how to set up the integration.

trans-unit.source: Configure logging

seg-source.mrk: Configure logging

trans-unit.source: The Workflow Accelerator system has its own application log file <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">effektif.log</kbd>. You need to define the directory where this log file is stored. The directory is specified in the file <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">$TOMCAT_HOME/webapps/ROOT/WEB-INF/classes/logback.xml</kbd>. Open the file and update the following line:

seg-source.mrk: The Workflow Accelerator system has its own application log file <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">effektif.log</kbd>.
You need to define the directory where this log file is stored.
The directory is specified in the file <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">$TOMCAT_HOME/webapps/ROOT/WEB-INF/classes/logback.xml</kbd>.
Open the file and update the following line:

trans-unit.source: The value should contain an absolute path. Make sure the user executing Tomcat has the required read / write permissions for the directory.

seg-source.mrk: The value should contain an absolute path.
Make sure the user executing Tomcat has the required read / write permissions for the directory.

trans-unit.source: On Windows it necessary to escape all "\". An example value could like this: <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">"C:\\Logs\\Signavio"</kbd>.

seg-source.mrk: On Windows it necessary to escape all "\".
An example value could like this: <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">"C:\\Logs\\Signavio"</kbd>.

trans-unit.source: This configuration file also enables you to change the log level in this file. By default, the log level is INFO. However, in a scenario where you require official support, you will be asked to set the log level to DEBUG. In order to so, update the following:

seg-source.mrk: This configuration file also enables you to change the log level in this file.
By default, the log level is INFO.
However, in a scenario where you require official support, you will be asked to set the log level to DEBUG.
In order to so, update the following:

trans-unit.source: Change it to:

seg-source.mrk: Change it to:

trans-unit.source: You will need to restart the Tomcat server for the changes to take effect. You can find more detailed information on how to start the Tomcat server in the next section.

seg-source.mrk: You will need to restart the Tomcat server for the changes to take effect.
You can find more detailed information on how to start the Tomcat server in the next section.

trans-unit.source: The log file is configured to do a roll over. Every day, a new log file is created which contains a timestamp in the filename similar to <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">effektif-2014-10-09.log</kbd>. The most recent log entries can still be found in the file <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">effektif.log</kbd>. After 30 days, the log files will be removed automatically.

seg-source.mrk: The log file is configured to do a roll over.
Every day, a new log file is created which contains a timestamp in the filename similar to <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">effektif-2014-10-09.log</kbd>.
The most recent log entries can still be found in the file <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">effektif.log</kbd>.
After 30 days, the log files will be removed automatically.
